item.title: Fail-safe metamaterials with 3D printed fiber reinforced polymers
item.description: Fail-safe is a design philosophy that ensures the structure’s safety under unexpected loading. Fail-safe structures often consist of many struts or parts because these structures prevent catastrophic failure with their structural redundancy. However, the fail-safe structures suffer the increasing number of components and enlarged structure size. Therefore, the knowledge to design mechanical structures that enclose a small number of components and are fail-safe stays challenging. Recent advanced additive manufacturing technologies provide complex and delicate structures that blur the boundary between “structure” and “material.
